lead_paragraph: BRICKMAN--Leon, Esq. The entire Yeshiva University family mourns the passing of Leon Brickman, Z"l, the beloved husband of the late Roslyn Brickman, Z"l, who was admired and respected by the entire community of Belle Harbour, NY and beyond. A man of extraordinary compassion and generosity for all individuals with special needs he led in the establishment of HIDEC, the Hebrew Institute for the Deaf and Exceptional Children, which he served as its President. He was a loyal citizen of America and was a navy veteran. His kindness, aristocratic demeanor, and pride in his Jewish heritage, caused him to be respected and appreciated by all who knew him. Leon Brickman, Z"l was the proud father of his wonderful children and their achievements: Rena (and Mordy) Rosen, Zahava (and Moshael) Straus and Noah (and Barbara) Brickman and a loving and beloved, grandfather and great grandfather. Zahava Straus is a member of the Cardozo Board of Overseers and Moshael Straus is Chair of the YU Board of Trustees and a RIETS Board of Trustees member. They have established and named The Joseph and Gwendolyn Straus Chair in Talmud at the Mazer School of Talmudic Studies and the Joseph and Gwendolyn Straus Chair in Jewish Education at the Azrieli Graduate School of Jewish Education and Administration of which Board he was Chair. More recently they established The Zahava and Moshael Straus Center for Torah and Western Thought at Yeshiva University. May the entire Brickman family find comfort among all who mourn for Zion and Jerusalem. Richard M. Joel, President, Yeshiva University Norman Lamm, President Emeritus 1/3
